title: Reziuan Mirzov
text:
Reziuan Mukhamedovich Mirzov (; born 22 June 1993) is a Russian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player of <a href="Kabardians">Kabardian</a> origin. He plays as a <a href="left%20winger">left winger</a> for <a href="FC%20Khimki">FC Khimki</a> on loan from <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">FC Spartak Moscow</a>.
Personal life.
He was born in <a href="Baksan%20%28town%29">Baksan</a>.
Club career.
He made his debut in the <a href="Russian%20National%20Football%20League">Russian National Football League</a> for <a href="PFC%20Spartak%20Nalchik">PFC Spartak Nalchik</a> on 22 August 2012 in a game against <a href="FC%20SKA-Energiya%20Khabarovsk">FC SKA-Energiya Khabarovsk</a>.
He scored a late winning goal as <a href="FC%20Tosno">FC Tosno</a> won the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Russian%20Cup">2017–18 Russian Cup</a> final with a score of 2–1 against <a href="FC%20Avangard%20Kursk">FC Avangard Kursk</a> on the 9 May 2018 in the <a href="Volgograd%20Arena">Volgograd Arena</a>.
On 31 August 2018, he joined <a href="FC%20Arsenal%20Tula">FC Arsenal Tula</a> on loan for the 2018–19 season.
On 18 July 2019, he signed a 3-year contract with <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">FC Spartak Moscow</a>.
On 2 October 2020, he was loaned to <a href="FC%20Khimki">FC Khimki</a> for the 2020–21 season.
On 7 September 2021, he returned to FC Khimki on a new loan for the 2021–22 season.
International career.
He was first called up to <a href="Russia%20national%20football%20team">Russia national football team</a> for <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202020%20qualifying%20Group%20I">UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying</a> matches against San Marino and Cyprus in June 2019.
On 11 May 2021, he was named as a back-up player for Russia's <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202020">UEFA Euro 2020</a> squad.
